content: 36 sts start by working 5 row of garter sts k all sts thereafter you work as follows rs row k all sts ws row k3 p30 k3 work at least 5 cm/2 work 5 row of garter k all sts bind off and secure yarn wash and block your swatch taking care to follow the washing instructions of the yarn you have been using measure the stockinette part of your swatch if there are 30 sts and 38 40 row/rounds to 10 cm/4 you have correct gauge and you may continue using the same needle size if you have too few sts less than 30 you need to change to finer needles if you have too many sts more than 30 you need to change to larger needles abbreviations st/sts = stitch/stitches / k = knit / p = purl / pm = place marker / sm = slip marker / rs = right side ws = wrong side / bor = beginning of round marker / est = established / rem = remaining k2tog = knit 2 sts together / p2tog = purl 2 sts together k1fb = knit 1 st in the front loop thereafter in the back loop of the same st m1r = make 1 st rightwise pick up the bar between the last stitch you knit and the one you re about to knit bringing the needle from the back to the front then knit into the front of this stitch m1l = make 1 st leftwise pick up the bar between the stitch you knit and the one you re about to knit bringing the needle from front to back then knit into the back of this stitch knitting instructions the lower body is worked in the round to underarms at underarms work is divided and the upper front and back are worked in separate pieces you work the button-band and a buttonhole-band over right shoulder the sleeves are worked top-down and in the round from picked-up sts along the armhole openings you work regular decreases and finish with a ribbed cuff the neck edging is worked in one piece from picked-up and live sts the finishing work is limited to blocking and weaving in loose ends 3 cast on for lower body using mc and the circular needle 40/40/40/60/60 cm 16/16/16/24/24 size 3 mm/us2 5 or needle size to obtain gauge cast on 126/146/166/186/206 sts you may use the long-tail cast-on the old norwegian cast-on or your preferred cast-on method place sts in the round make sure not to twist the sts pm in front of the first st the marker is placed on the left side of the pullover and indicates the bor the ribbed hem using mc round 1 rs sm k1 p1 repeat - to end of round work 3/3/3/5/5 more rounds in rib-pattern as est in round 1 end at marker bor the stripe-pattern work the first 4 rounds as follows round 1 using mc sm k all
